page.title: 14THE UPLANDS COMMUNITY CENTRE
page.content: Work on the Uplands Community Centre building was started on 12th March 1985. The Community Centre is for the people of Burnt Hill, Hollow Grove & Rosedale Gardens Estates, because they had no hall for clubs or meetings. They hope it will open for Christmas '85. The size of the building is 24m long & 20m wide. It will cost 100,000 pounds & some of the money was raised by fetes & jumble sales. We went to see the first brick layed by the chairman & our photo was in the paper. Outside there will be a football pitch, car park & a hard area for ball games. The clubs will be for all age groups. They include badmington, Brownies, Cubs, keep fit, disco's, bingo, a play group, and a clinic to weigh your baby & many more. The hall can be hired for functions. It is a very nice place.
